questions.question_text: What is a limitation of a Materialized View?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Materialized view can be joined with other tables. But you cannot include JOIN in a materialized view definition

Selected Answer: D
D, how come that som many answers from basic definitions are wrong?

comments.content: sorry i read the option wrong. this is correct
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/views-materialized, can be used with a Join is a clear statement here.

discussion.content:
A. A Materialized View cannot support any aggregate functions - Wrong - supports few aggregate functions but with some restrictions.
B. A Materialized View can only reference up to two tables - Wrong - can query only a single table.
C. A Materialized View cannot be joined with other tables - Wrong - We can.
D. A Materialized View cannot be defined with a JOIN - Correct - Joins, including self-joins, are not supported.
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
answer is. D

Answer C does not make any sense at all. There is no concept of joining materialized views by another tables.
Tables, per se, can join. So answer is D

Selected Answer: D
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/views-materialized#limitations-on-creating-materialized-views

Answer is correct
Answer is B. Query results contain a small number of rows and/or columns relative to the base table (the table on which the view is defined).The base table, only one table.
@SexyPotato option B says 2 tables. Only D is correct.

Selected Answer: D
D is the answer, but B is also correct, in that you can only reference 1 table.

Selected Answer: D
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/views-materialized.html#limitations-on-creating-materialized-views

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D

choices.C: A Materialized View cannot be joined with other tables
choices.D: A Materialized View cannot be defined with a JOIN
choices.A: A Materialized View cannot support any aggregate functions

Selected Answer: D
To own an object means that a role has the OWNERSHIP privilege on the object. Each securable object is owned by a single role, which by default is the role used to create the object.

Selected Answer: D
Only ROLE can OWN the object.

D is correct

choices.C: Ownership depends on the type of object
choices.A: The user who created the object
choices.D: The role used to create the object
